body: Thanks for cleaning this up.
Green branch builder: https://jenkins.confluent.io/job/system-test-kafka-branch-builder/885/

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk7-scala2.10/3655/
Test FAILed (JDK 7 and Scala 2.10).
@cmccabe It seems all the callers that could access it are already synchronized at the object level?

```
kafka.controller.ControllerIntegrationTest > testPreferredReplicaLeaderElection FAILED
org.apache.kafka.streams.integration.QueryableStateIntegrationTest > queryOnRebalance FAILED
```

@ijuma, @ewencp, @enothereska, @hachikuji: can someone please review ? 
Please note that each of failed tests above is obviously not related to my tiny change (tests pass locally, see my comments above).

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk8-scala2.12/3653/
Test PASSed (JDK 8 and Scala 2.12).

They are not synchronized on the same lock.  RocksDbIterator#close synchronizes on the RocksDbIterator lock (which will be a different lock for each iterator object), and there are a few other accesses that synchronize on the RocksDBStore lock (which is different than the iterator locks)

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk8-scala2.11/3663/
Test PASSed (JDK 8 and Scala 2.11).

@eno I'm still wondering why the rebalance could take forever, since we only have a single thread that will own all the tasks, and it has graceful shutdown / re-start so there should be no restoration at all?

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk7-scala2.10/3657/
Test PASSed (JDK 7 and Scala 2.10).

I am wondering if it would be better, to "embed" the dry-run into the actual code and branch on each place. Otherwise, if things get changed, we could easily introduce bugs (ie, dry run show something different than what the actual reset code does.

We could introduce methods like `mabyeSeekToBeginning()` that either does the seek or only prints to stdout. This would ensure that the main logic is used to "feed" into dry-run and we don't have code duplication.

WDYT?
@guozhangwang Unless you say otherwise, I'll hold off merging this until your TC patch is in.

@porshkevich The original `ensureCoordinatorReady` blocks until the coordinator is known, whereas your version of `ensureCoordinatorReady` seems to return nothing back to clients even when the timeout expires. Sounds like you'd better inform clients of the timeout and have them exit from the `poll` actively.

Those test are a little flaky -- some people are active working to identify the root cause in order to stabilize the build (eg. https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-4222 )

> In a low resource env, everything competes for a bit of resources, the producer thread, the main streams thread and the rebalancing. It all crawls.

@enothereska Okay, I think I'm a bit over-concerned with your description that `rebalance take forever` since it is only a single thread, so if it really take very long to create tasks / restore it would be a problem.
Hi @rajinisivaram this is the minor PR I was mentioning to you yesterday
